page.title: 11A CHILD'S SUNDAY
page.content: MOST FAMILIES{GET UP LATER}ON SUNDAY MORNINGS. IT APPEARS THAT IN THE LYNWORTH AND WHADDON AREA, VERY FEW CHILDREN GO TO{CHURCH}ON SUNDAY MORNING. MORE TIME WOULD BE SPENT {READING THE NEWSPAPERS}THAN ON A WEEKDAY MORNING. SOME CHILDREN WOULD GO TO THE{SUNDAY MARKET}HELD AT CHELTENHAM RACECOURSE AND QUITE A FEW WOULD BUY SWEETS FROM THE PAPER SHOP. {SUNDAY DINNER}IS STILL A TRADITIONAL EVENT IN THE FAMILY. IT WOULD USUALLY BE A ROAST MEAL RATHER THAN A SNACK LUNCH. MANY FAMILIES WOULD REMAIN INDOORS DURING THE AFTERNOON, PROBABLY WATCHING TELEVISION, AND A FEW MAY {VISIT RELATIONS}SUCH AS GRANDPARENTS. SOME CHILDREN MAY GO WITH THEIR PARENTS TO THE PUB FOR A DRINK AT LUNCH TIME. EVENINGS ARE SPENT INDOORS, ALSO WATCHING TELEVISION.
